title: Miles Davis - “Tutu”
content:
Would be very grateful if someone could identify the font.

Font: 

 Why Square 

Solved By: 

 [Les ONeill](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416030213/http:/typophile.com/user/216897 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [bd96e9de81d039437618a9c4fc370ce1.405204.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416030213/http:/typophile.com/files/bd96e9de81d039437618a9c4fc370ce1.405204.png) | 395.71 KB |
author: inktrap

comments.content: Actually, Linotype’s site says “Designed by Zoran Kostic in 2004” and that album art is the original version from 1986.
Perhaps you could ask the co-designer of the album cover, [Susan Welt](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416030213/https:/www.behance.net/susanwelt).

With an ultra simplified design like this and only 8 letters of the alphabet, I can see this as being a case of independent development of a similar alphabet in 1986 or earlier [for the album cover] and in 2004 [as Why Square]. Among the differences in the two sets of 8 letters, I note that 1986 has shorter ascenders, the lower terminals on \_e\_ and \_s\_ of 1986 are double the length of 2004, the 1986 \_a\_ upper stroke includes a vertical drop terminal ....  
Don
